publicationstmt.publisher: Jewish Historical Society of Greater Hartford

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-02-05T12:01-0500

repository.corpname: Jewish Historical Society of Greater Hartford

physdesc.extent: 4 Boxes of collection records 5 boxes of photographs

did.abstract: This collection consists of newspaper clippings, advertisements, and memorabilia documenting the activities of Jewish business people and Jewish professionals (physicians, attorneys, artists, musicians, etc.) throughout the Hartford area.

acqinfo.p: Copies of receipts for Nathan Burres, c. 1904, donated by his grandson Mr. David Wald in November, 1991.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains newspaper articles and obituaries from the Hartford Courant, the Hartford Jewish Ledger, the Connecticut Jewish Ledger, and Imprint Newspapers. Contains a photocopy of the 1985 Classified Advertising Supplement to the Hartfourd Courant, "100 Years of the Automobile", whose original resides in Oversize/Business/Misc. Also contains copies of invoice forms for Nathan Burres, Dr., for "Carriages, Wagons and General Jobbng. Horse Shoeing and Auto Repairing A Specialty."

This publication contains a substantial amount of material, including photographs, pertaining to the history of Hartford and the Society for Savings branch operations.

Also an article discussing the 40th anniversary of Esquire Cleaners and its original owner Emil Ellenberg.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains newspaper articles from The Hartford Courant and the Connecticut Jewish Ledger featuring stories on Bazilian's clothing store on Park Road in Hartford, CT and its owner, Marc Bazilian. Bazilian's, originally located on Front Street and was founded in 1930 by Joseph M. Bazilian, an immigrant from Vilna.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials note

did.unittitle: Businesses/Fuel Oil/Engineering Services Inc., Julius Feinberg, 1940s. see also Jewish War Veterans for information about Feinberg

physdesc.extent: Contains three original envelopes on Julius Feinberg Oil Heating letterhead. Also contains photocopies of articles and photos.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file contains photocopies of newspaper articles and photos relating to Julius Feinberg, including a full-page for Nokol-Aetna Oil Burner. There are also three original envelopes on Julius Feinberg Oil Heating Co. letterhead.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials note
separatedmaterial.p: Originals of the photocopies reside in the Julius Feinberg Scrapbook file of the Jewish War Veterans collection.

physdesc.extent: Photocopies of articles and of 1904 envelope; 1937 magazine article; newspaper clippings; postcard advertisement

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The highlight of this file is a 1937 magazine article, "Toubman Keeps Pace With Changing Times," announcing the opening of a Hartford service station by Wm. Toubman & Sons Inc. Also contains a photocopied envelope postmarked 1904 on H. Fine letterhead; original and photocopied articles from the Hartford Courant, including obituaries and retirement announcements for regional fuel oil and gas industry members and advertisements; and a 1997 article discussing the influence of coal research on the computer industry.

did.unittitle: Businesses/Fuel Oil and Gas/American Coal Company

physdesc.extent: Photocopies of fliers, articles, advertisements, photograph

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photocopies of articles, photographs, advertisements, fliers and correspondence, from the Hartford Courant, the New Britain Herald, the News Weekly, the Hartford Times and other papers, concerning the American Coal Co. Inc. between 1936 and 1943. Highlights include an internal memo on scrap rubber collection, a bulletin entitled "Instruction Given for Oil Rationing" and a letter to American Coal customers urging customers to buy their winter coal a year early, as well as several invitations to the American Coal Co. annual stag parties.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Highlights include a 1918 receipt for a sale made by Feinberg Bros. and a 1959 newspaper advertisement for Barney's from the Jewish Ledger. Also contains photocopies of newspaper articles, advertisements, and obituraries from the Hartford Courant and the Jewish Ledger and other ads and fliers for furniture stores in the region.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: Originals of full-size ad for Shoor Brothers and Hartford Courant article "The man whose voice you love to hate" (regarding Bob's Discount Furniture) located in Oversize/Business/Misc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains the June 1997 Hartfourd Courant article "They came out for Mr. 'Come on down'".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photocopies of newspaper articles, including oversize copies of the May 13, 1953 Hartford Times Financial News announcement of the grand opening of the new Marholin's location at 1177 Main Street.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: One undated, handwritten balance sheet from I. Burstein meat market.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a photocopy of a full-page advertisement for Copaco from the March 4, 1967 Hartford Times, as well as a 2005 newspaper article in the Hartford Courant announcing the sale of the company by the Bercowetz family.

physdesc.extent: Typewritten employee biographies; excerpt of the Federal Supplemen in re Crown Kosher Super Market, Inc. v. Gallagher; coupon circulars; photocopied and original newspaper articles, advertisements, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Folder contains typewritten biographies of partner/owners of Crown Market and materials which detail the history of this Kosher market in Hartford. Included are Crown Market coupon circulars and advertisements. Also folder contains many original and photocopied newspaper articles regarding Crown Market from the Hartford Courant, the Jewish Ledger, and the New York Times.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Folder contains newspaper article from the Ledger (04/04/1991) featuring story on the decision of the Finest super store in West Hartford to offer Kosher foods under rabbinical supervision.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: After glamorous and highly publicized beginnings, Colonial Realty achieved notoriety in the late 1980s and 1990s for unethical and illegal business practices. The failure of Colonial Realty contributed to the economic decline of Hartford during that period. This collection consists of newspaper clippings that document the rise and fall of the company and its principals, Frank Shuch, Benjamin Sisti, William Calderoni, and Jonathan Googel.
